definition: to restrict the movement of by bonds or obstacles : impede
examples: pitching … violently in the seaway, hampered by her heavy tow

definition: to interfere with the operation of : disrupt
to moderate or limit the effect or full exercise of : curb, restrain
examples: a work environment that hampers creativity

definition: to interfere with : to impede the natural activity of : encumber
examples: Bad weather hampered the search effort.
a project hampered by budget restraints

definition: a large basket usually with a cover for packing, storing, or transporting articles (such as food or laundry)
